result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald L Colbert Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State by Nelson / Def w Atty Tom Huh
Def plead & sentenced in 12CF583
THIS CASE IS DISMISSED & READ-IN

State by Minser / Atty Tom Huh / Def NA
HUH:  def is available by phone if CRT wants - he has no transportation to get here...Def is very interested in pleading as soon as possible
CRT:  there is letter from JS
HUH:  did not get copy of that
CRT:  Violation of GPS - def traveled to LAX & stayed 2 days & then went back...Def could ask VA for ride to CRT - they do it daily
MINSER:  leaves up to CRT
CRT:  will give def 1 more chance to show up
PLEA HRG cont'd to 3-6-14 @ 2:30 pm w/ EML
CRT:  tell def he must be here or warrant w/b issued

Justice Sanctions Violations notice, filed in 12CF583
EML: had a hearing today - Note & file

State by Minser / Atty Huh
HUH:  I don't have anything in my file indicating this was on for today
CRT:  def was in Tomah VA program, has PO in Tomah, it seems there was cross info between DOC here & there.  I won't issue warrant today - try to find where he is
PLEA:  Robin to set before 3-6-14  (2-28-14 @ 8:30)

From: atty Huh Re: registere w/JS, having trouble getting there since his car went missing
EML: noted

11 am Def in court w/Atty Thomas Y Huh.  Jessica L Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds he F, V & I wavies his right to a PH.  Probable cause found - Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Stands Mute - NG Pleas entered.

PTC:  2/7 at 1:30 pm;  STATUS:  3/6 at 10 am   EML

Court asks what's going on with his other case.  Huh asks that he be lifed from the homeless program.  Mr. Colbert says the VA recommends after care.  Had an appartment and was in aftercare.  Skemp:  He told Ofc. Reinfleisch he was homeless when he was arrested.  He's not been cooperative either.  I don't see an address other than the Tomah VA.  He failed to appear in Dec.  Court:  Are you able to get back into the homeless program?  Colberts says he can but it'll take a few days.  Court:  Mr. Colbert, you don't get to choose what you can do.  I don't have anything acout the aftercare program.  You know the system fairly well.  This something you need to be responsible for.  Skemp:  He just got released this moning.  Court:  So he has no where to live. I think you should go back to the homeless program.  I don't feel comfortable with you just living in a home even if the DOC thinks it's OK.  You have to communicate what's going on.

I'm going to keep that you have to comply with the VA after care program.  You need to go to JS and tell them where you're going to be.
Probable Cause Stmt & Judicial Determination - signed by EML

State by Nelson / Def in custody w/ Atty Beatty (for Huh)
Copy of Complaint to Def
$10,000 Signature bond signed by def w/ conditions:  No Contact w/ Elgin S.;  No alcohol;  No drugs or cont subs w/o valid prescription;  Reside @ VA & follow trmt;  Comply w/ JS w/ GPS;  If def is not in VA program, bond to convert to $10,000 cash bond
Prelim Hrg:  1-13-14 @ 11am w/ EML
